website_summaries.verdict: You can buy a better-performing vacuum for far less money, making the Dyson Ball Compact Animal a poor value.
pros: The Dyson Ball Compact Animal performs well on carpeted surfaces with most types of debris
The canister is easy to empty and the vacuum itself is simple to use
cons: The Ball Compact Animal didn't outperform other vacuums the way you'd expect it to for its price

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and awkward clogging monstrosity
customer_reviews.text: The design is a problem because it gets clogged EVERY TIME I vacuum. My vacuuming activity looks like this: 1. vacuum for a few mins 2. notice its spitting out more dirt than picking up 3. Stop vacuuming, take apart unclog 4. Vacuum up the dirt that came out with the clog 5. Repeat... Also, it's a battle of wits to get the wand to come apart from the body. It has a button release but then you have to grab the wand at the top and try to coax it out of the death grip of its cradle. Enough is enough. Even though I paid over $400 for this atrocious model, I'm chucking it out.
customer_reviews.author: likesmyalpacas

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: have been using it since end of July - it doesn't pick up things on a vinyl floor as expected and shown in commercials like pieces of lettuce leaves, small pebbles (have to lift the back of the unit up then pull the unit over the pebble to vacuum it up, motor quits sometimes when pulling back on a carpet, then have to push the stop button, get off the carpet and restart - wouldn't buy another one says same as Dyson DC50 animal but??? not the same as the animal we saw demonstrated in a store
customer_reviews.author: Penny Keay

customer_reviews.title: Poor plastic made stuff- not worth the big tech ad Dyson makes
customer_reviews.text: I won this product and this is the vacuum cleaner that has given me the most problems. This is poorly constructed, very cheap material and and no exceptional technology that Dyson swears about. Every now and then this product stopped working and I had to reach out their customer service or the workshop which is pretty far from my home. DO NOT pay twice as much for a product that is not half as good as other products from Hoover, Shark etc. I also have a hand vacuum from Dyson and that is in the same category as its big brother. I will never buy Dyson products,
customer_reviews.author: Ravish Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Was great in the beginning but didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product when I first got it. However, after about 1 year it started acting up so my husband had to fix some parts on it. I was super disappointed because the vacuum was only a little more then a year old and I had paid $300 for the vacuum. Now, on 5/11/2020 my vacuum has completely died. I was in the middle of vacuuming and it made a loud whining sound and then shut off. VERY disappointed in this product. I have only had this product for 3 years and am not hard on it. I have 2 dogs and have only vacuumed up dirt/dog hair. This product should have lasted MUCH longer!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis M. Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Noticing some quality issues after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is definitely fierce on carpet. The clear canister makes it that much more visual/disgusting watching this little vacuum do its thing. I do have a serious complaint though, and that is that the whole vacuum feels a bit delicate to me. I've had it for about 6 months and there are chunks of missing bristles on the agitator brush and I cringe a little when I bump a piece of furniture with it because of how plastic and delicate it feels. I'm hoping I can take this thing and have a new agitator put on at a servicing just like I used to be able to with my Orel.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: The cannister is impossible to clean out all the dog hair. I need to take along tool and dig it out. It doesn't shake out. The center of the cannister should be redesigned. Also, the arm of the cleaner constantly is coming apart although it is secured. I have had a Dyson before that is why I ordered this. It is terrible!. I tried to contact the company early on but got no response. I will never buy another nor will I recommend it to anyone. For what I paid I feel it should be replaced. I purchased it in April but did not even use it until I moved in may. I hate it. Liz Bulgarelli
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not dyson’s best work
customer_reviews.text: Dyson is an acquired taste. They have their quirks. That said, I thought I had adjusted to the brand. However, this one is quirkier than usual. The little irritating things about the Dyson are magnified. When you pull the hose out, unless you do it with the care of deactivating a bomb, the unit falls apart and you’re five minutes getting it to click back together. The dust bin is very small. If you have large animals that shed a lot, get a bigger vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Lola L. Potter

customer_reviews.title: idk
customer_reviews.text: I'm hoping after not quite a year I can get a refund. It gets blocked up after doing one bedroom. Now suddenly stopped working. I have researched this vacuum and hear its crap. Wish more reviews on here would of been negative or I would've never bought it. I finally figured out where the clog is. It is where the roller part is. Someone told me I pretty much have to check that once a month to get any debris out of there. Never had that issue on other vacuums. I have had some but nothing like this
customer_reviews.author: Jill Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Efficiency vs. Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Dyson for $235.00 as a showroom model. I own two (2) dogs and have a family of four. In all honesty, this vacuum maneuvers excellent with the ball and it does not seem to lose suction. It self-adjusts to the height of whatever surface you're vacuuming. However, I would not have paid top dollar for it which is $400+. To me, it cleans but it could be somewhat better for the price being charged. It's about two steps above the Bissell One-Pass I bought on Amazon for $69 during the holiday season as far as cleaning efficiency goes. Buy used (but close to new as possible) or do some more homework for a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was without a doubt a big disappointment. I had a larger Dyson DC 17 for animal hair but it was heavy and finally died after many years of hard use. I purchased this because it was smaller and lighter, it wasn't until I got and used it did I realize how really bad it was to use. Using the pull out rod (which is very short) and trying to put it back on is a nightmare. The only good thing is the suction head but the canister is so small you have to empty it in the middle of vacuming. For the price I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looser Machine
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Dyson for 1 year. I have only been able to use it 4 times. This machine plugs every time it is used. I am VERY clean and I do have a Doberman. Doberman's are known for VERY little shedding and this is an Animal Dyson. This looser machine clogs in the ball assembly and the lint and debris that it picks up NEVER makes it to the collection bin for future emptying. This is the POOREST vacuum that I have ever owned. If you buy this unit, you are getting a machine that will not perform as expected. This machine is a LOOSER!
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Durham

customer_reviews.title: The Dyson Died at Age  Two
customer_reviews.text: When this vacuum worked it was incredible. Over time I noticed it became less effective and about six months ago it stopped cleaning, period. The brush doesn't turn, the suction is gone, I've kept the canister clean and although I know it came with a 5 year warranty, I'm 70 years old and disabled so packaging this up and taking it to UPS is impossible for me. What should I do??
customer_reviews.author: Elizabethan Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Interestingly enough we don't vacuum often so that further adds to the point that this machine was not a good purchase. Yes
customer_reviews.text: Barely over a year after purchasing and there is no suction and it overheats and shuts off. Interestingly enough we don't vacuum often so that further adds to the point that this machine was not a good purchase. Yes, we cleaned the heads, filters, we tried everything to no avail. I didn't bother with going through the hassle of looking into a warranty etc. I was so disappointed that I didn't feel like dealing with it an decided to move on and buy a different product. As far as looks...it looks cool...but doesn't deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should’ve bought it at one of the Super Stores where I could take it back for an ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked up my Amazon orders to get the info on my recently purchased Dyson vacuum. The vacuum stopped working when I last used it , it has absolutely no power when the on button is pushed. You can understand my complete dissatisfaction when I saw that the return date expired on the 15th of October just 6 days ago. To have spent 345.00 on a new product and for it to work for only a month is unbelievable. I should’ve bought it at one of the Super Stores where I could take it back for an exchange .
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Fine for a year...nothing but problems thereafter.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this vacuum almost 4 years now and I'm finally getting around to kicking it to the curb. A little over a year in, it clogged...a lot. Forget customer service; they find nice ways to ask what you did wrong. We cleaned the filters as indicated and emptied it before reaching the max fill line, but still it clogged. Going out today to get a Hoover as I've had before and never an issue. This Dyson is an overpriced clogging machine. Don't know about other Dyson products but won't ever buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Racon2R

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum has a two year life span.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum in oct 2016, it lasted until dec 2018 when the main motor burned out. no heavy vacuuming, regular household vacuum jobs, regular filter changes. I think the product is cheaply made with inferior plastic and should last way longer for the price. My 2 cents.
customer_reviews.author: agustin a. cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in his vacuum. I've been wanting this for a longtime and finally pulled the trigger on spending the money. Assembly was fine, then when I vacuumed my rug, I went over one area a few times and it didn't pick up crumbs that my cheap vacuum regularly picks up. For the cost of this product, I would expect it to vacuum up most things, especially crumbs on the first run. Maybe the big animal ball vacuum works better, but for the cost of this one I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: cmd

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic machine. After sweeping and mopping
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic machine.After sweeping and mopping,I used this for the 1st time and wow.I live with 3 dogs and a cat and you can imagine the fur trails.This picked up so much that I missed with a broom and a mop,wish I had gotten one sooner..I almost bought a roomba but this is better for those of whose pets lounge on our furniture as well.I also have hardwoods and it works great on that.. I am very happy with my purchase and I got a great deal ,$269.99.Thank You Amazon..Love My Dyson....
customer_reviews.author: Leisa  in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the hassle, DO NOT PURCHASE. It breaks all the time, Dyson wont replace anything and I spent way too much time traveling 40 miles to get it repaired at Dyson. I bought a new cheap vac from a local box store and it works 100 times better. If I could give zero stars I would. My mom has a different version of Dyson and it works but this version - DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Get the full size, more suction.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to really like this vacuum as it is lighter, but the suction power just did not work for me. I have a dog and did not pick any hair or dust (as it claims) from hardwood floors. It works okay in rugs, but I was expecting a lot more from Dyson.
customer_reviews.author: texasdip

customer_reviews.title: Great suction; itty bitty capacity
customer_reviews.text: It has powerful suction but little capacity--we have to empty the unit frequently. Would work better at a small house/apartment. Wish I had payed a little more for the standard sized one. It is nice and light however, so that helps as my kids are better able to operate it (that's one excuse eliminated ;) ). The unit is also very easy to disassemble in the event of a clog. Parts feel fairly cheap however--as though I could break them without much effort. Overall, I think it is overpriced by about $100-150.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Picks up more dirt than any other vacuum I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: I just finding new reasons to love this little work horse! The two filters are so EASY to clean, easy to get to and don't need replacing each time! The ball feature really maneuvers around my complicated floor pattern plus the pull out wand is easy to access. But most of all, my floors are cleaner than they've ever been! I used to empty my old vacuum after vacuuming the whole house. This vacuum picks up SO MUCH MORE that I empty it every two rooms! I wish the cord had a auto winder then I'd say it was PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Finally found the perfect vacuum for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dyson DC14 I bought about 7 years ago. I love how well it cleans, but it's rather heavy and doesn't maneuver too well. Its weight has always been a problem for me to take it up or down stairs. I bought an inexpensive Dirt Devil for those areas of the house. But now I have this Dyson DC50 and it's perfect: light enough to carry up and down stairs easily, maneuvers like a breeze with the ball instead of wheels, and still has the "animal" power to pick up any cat hair in my house. That Dirt Devil I've been using went to Goodwill as soon as I started using this new Dyson DC50.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know my floors weren't clean until I cleaned them with this vacuum. As a two pet owner, I've found this to be quite a great little cleaner to get all the allergens up, and easily. Coming from a Walmart-special Bissel vacuum, it's a world changer.
customer_reviews.author: babyjeans

customer_reviews.title: Plugs all the time
customer_reviews.text: Plugs all the time. Take everything apart to get it cleaned and it plugs right away with dog hair. Annoying I'm going to have to try and return it. Update sent it back to get it fixed. Didn't work. Feel like I got taken for the amount of money spent and how worthless this is. Isn't even useful vacuuming rugs only.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Very happy now!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Great suction & easy to use. Had a shark for years & hated it! Always tipping over, too many attachments to store, suction was poor and my shoulder length hair always getting tangled in the roller (so had to deal with cutting it out & cleaning the roller before each use-ugh). Was so happy to get the Dyson, so vacuuming wasn't such a chore anymore. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great vac for golden retriever hair
customer_reviews.text: Great vac for golden retriever hair, use every day. Cord just a bit too short for my use, would be a disqualifier. Also, the location of the cord connection is too low. Just in the right position to trip you up , as happens every use. Our housekeeper fell at another client with this machine and will not use it. Needs design changes for me to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joethesailor

customer_reviews.title: Light
customer_reviews.text: easy to carry This vacuum is light and slim but yet doesn't have the suction power of the full-size Dyson I was a little disappointed about this. I would recommend the vacuum for maybe someone that lives in an apartment may be a one-bedroom two-bedroom apartment not for a home.
customer_reviews.author: Your Kidding Me

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a dyson i gave in and got one for our pethair and his works absolutely anazing and picks up stuff i cant w the other vaccuum. Very easy to use and clean. Light in weight for all It does! Def worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Lauramayzing

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend the money. No suction. Never really ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't spend the money. No suction. Never really worked. Cleaned it many times and keep going back to my old (25 yrs), falling apart, Miele. Bought this one a year ago because of my son's allergies and our new cat. Really really regret it. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Don Bohlinger

customer_reviews.title: I won't buy another Dyson
customer_reviews.text: Very good marketing Dyson. Good power. Easy to clean, but it is flimsy and the wand never worked out of the box. Can you back it up with a good vacuum next time? I paid way too much for this and got longer lasting performance from $50 used vacuums. I should have sent it back the first day. Shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL MECHANIC

customer_reviews.title: Everything about it is terrible. Like some guy on a computer model thought ...
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is the "Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull" of vacuums -- it just never should have happened. Everything about it is terrible. Like some guy on a computer model thought all these features would be cool and efficient, but in real life they just aren't. I love Dyson and have told friends and family for years about how great they are, but this vacuum is just the worst. I sent it back and got the old-school Grandma upright version, like I used to have before. They dropped the ball on this one (pun intended).
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is not worth the huge $ we paid for it. Three gripes: Hose thing doesn't work because the rigid portion of the hose is too long making it non maneuverable. Used it once and gave up. It clogs all the time. Supposedly it's for pet hair, yet the dog hair clogs the tiny hole behind the brush bar. Then the brush bar stopped working, so now it's useless. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Garff

customer_reviews.title: would not buy dyson again
customer_reviews.text: Like other dyson vacs, this is a dynamo, but with a real advantage for city dwellers: it takes up lots less storage space than a full sized dyson. Yes, the bin is smaller, so it needs to be emptied more often, but otherwise it performs just as well. It's also very light weight and maneuvers very easily. HOWEVER it is totally unreliable. I have bought this unit 2 times. After the first one died I thought must be a fluke. Now the second one died. Also, I had the larger model as well. It ALSO died. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: no suction. It spun and picked up items but ...
customer_reviews.text: no suction. It spun and picked up items but did not have the lines a vacuum cleaner makes when it has a deep clean. I cleaned the room with this first and then with my old vacuum cleaner just to see if my suspicions were correct. It had no suction. It was used...
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Terrible and overpriced!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is a huge disappointment. So over priced! It clogs every time is sweep even if I empty it after every room. It is flimsy and basically junk. The attachments are junk and do not do a good job at all. There is no suction with them to sweep edges of rooms or hard to reach places. I am so disappointed. After fighting with this vacuum for a year, I am fed up and bought a different vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: patrick c. Yeend

customer_reviews.title: I hate the way the hose is put into the vacuum ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be the vacuum of all vacuums but it's not. I hate the way the hose is put into the vacuum casing and it's hard to get out and very short I would definitely not recommend this to anyone who wants an upright vacuum that also has a good hose on it to be able to clean furniture and get in corners.
customer_reviews.author: Skye Love

customer_reviews.title: When it comes to cleaning this one is spot on
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum picks up objects like no other. However I will say it is a bit confusing when it comes to adding the attachments but we're over that already. My thought is that the more I use the attachments the easier it will become. I've never had a vacuum which cleans the way this one does. Great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: kdg

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have the full size version of this vacuum that is 10 years old and was excited to get this for laminate floors. Does not have anywhere near the suction power of my older vacuum. I can vacuum and then immediately go over with the old one and pull up way more dirt. I have two dogs who shed and I vacuum almost daily. Regret ever making this purchase. Way too expensive for this poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT the same Dyson I am used to owning
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this DC50 Ball Compact Animal because the 1st Dyson Animal DC 28 I purchased was amazing. Lasted almost 10 years of heavy use and I bragged about it. Home with 2 long haired dogs and 3 cats. New one already has problems. First, too small for my house. It has to be emptied at least 4 to 5 times in one cleaning. Started it up today and it started "spitting" dirt out. Amazon, Can I return it? I have until 02/07/2017. I am going to get my old one repaired, if possible. This one does NOT stand up to too much hair and dust. I have a cleaning lady weekly. But, this one is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would be lost without it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Oreck bit the dust after 10 years and they wanted almost $200 to fix it. It was barely picking up any dirt. But, the Dyson is incredible. I can't believe all of the dust and dirt that it picks up. I had no idea how much yuck accumulates in a house. The Dyson is also really easy to empty and to use. The only trick, that really stumped me was putting it together properly, so I watched a Youtube video. So glad I bought it instead of fixing the expensive Oreck!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne S Adams

customer_reviews.title: Does great cleaning,yet easy to manuever
customer_reviews.text: Does fabulous job cleaning all floors.picks up cat hair from my two kittys,with ease.lightweight,but strong suction /would not want to be without this
customer_reviews.author: a, j.

customer_reviews.title: I've started calling around vacuum shops and I continue to hear bad reviews about dyson
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the animal upright because I have 2 long hair cats and this vacuum claims it will not clog. It clogs! I've been using it for 10 months and it has locked up. It is under warranty so I won't incur the repair cost but I need to rent a vacuum in the interim. I've started calling around vacuum shops and I continue to hear bad reviews about dyson. I'm regretting my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara L. Luffy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I would have to say that I am not really pleased with how flimsy this vacuum is for the amount of money I paid. It seems to pick up well but not any better than the heavier competing model that I have. I just don't see this model holding up for very long before something breaks. I may be boxing this up and sending back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the DC50
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, picks up a ton of dirt and dog hair. Very easy to use, it's nice to be able to roll right off the carpet onto the hard floor without having to change anything. My wife loves it, and it's light and small enough to grab out of the closet for a quick clean up of a small mess without a big hassle. We have been very pleased with it. The cord is a little short, but we knew that going in (it is after all the compact version).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fundenberger

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this by mistake thinking it was the full size animal vacuum. When I purchased this it said "animal" in the description which I see has now been removed. After returning this vacuum and doing a little research I found that this model is much cheaper elsewhere than here on Amazon. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered earlier than expected! Great product - I had no idea my cat was shedding so much! Carpet looks cleaner than when it was new! I have already recommended this vacuum cleaner to my friends who have pets.
customer_reviews.author: abear

customer_reviews.title: It sucks! But in a great way! >P
customer_reviews.text: We have two Siberian Huskies and when it's time for synchronized shedding, our other vacuum just couldn't cut it. The Dyson pulled so much additional fir and dirt out of the carpet that we were disturbed by it...and happy at the same time. Thanks Dyson for making an awesome vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Moore

customer_reviews.title: Always loses suction.
customer_reviews.text: I had a much larger model of a Dyson, so when we needed a new one, I wanted to come back to the brand. This particular model does not have the type of power needed for a whole house. It clogs constantly and loses suction. For the price we paid, we could have gotten a full sized Shark vacuum. We just spent an hour unclogging it- such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Ritchey

customer_reviews.title: Actually ordered an older model which I just love. Wish they would not have discontinued the older ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent back because the canister was way to small for all the vacuuming I have to do. Otherwise, I have always been a real Dyson fan. Actually ordered an older model which I just love. Wish they would not have discontinued the older models. They were made much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine Manning-Gray

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced flimsy and mostly useless.
customer_reviews.text: When my old Wind Tunnel gave up the ghost I decided to get this for my basement which is mostly wood floors. I hate the thing. It is flimsy and won't pick up much of anything. My hand vacuum does a better job. I can't believe I spent this much money on such a useless machine. Then when I empty it, dust and dog hair go flying everywhere. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone for even the lightest jobs. At the moment I am schlepping my Riccar canister up and down the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Webster

customer_reviews.title: Performance degradation with long hair species of pets.
customer_reviews.text: We have a husky and 2 cats. This smaller compact version requires emptying the canister multiple times during one vacuuming of 3-4 rooms. the top filter requires regular cleanings or the suction degrades to the point where the dog hair gets clogged in the center intake tube before making it into the canister. The tool hose is too short. when cleaning overhead I am constantly lifting the vacuum off the floor. Although this vacuum performs well now that we know how to regularly maintain the filters, I would only recommend this model to someone with short hair species of pets and those that live in smaller apartment type dwellings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I had an original yellow big Dyson. I loved it. It was the only vacuum I owned for more than a year. I had it for about 12-15 years. I finally had to say good bye and bought this model. It was awful. It was cheaply made. It felt like a toy. When you uses the handle and the hose the suction was awful. Worst $400 I ever spent. So disappointed. Changed to a shark lift away. Much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Endy

customer_reviews.title: Have tried to rest and this one is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have had all brands and types of vacuum cleaners and this on completely surpasses every one I have ever had before, power, maneuverability and all at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Damon Frost

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed and happy with this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is compact, but I can do my entire house with it. It is powerful and light. This may sound silly, but of the probably 10 vacs of various brands and price ranges (from cheap to car payment cost) we have owned over the years it is the first that does not shoot sand/cat litter out the back when using on a bare floor. :-) So far, I am impressed and happy with this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: One would hope that when spending $400 on a vacuum from a company as recognized as Dyson, you would receive a quality product. You would be wrong. Did great for a couple months then slowly lost power despite repeated cleaning and trouble shooting. I'd have been far better off with some random $50 vacuum from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Good for stairs
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. Good for stairs. Great, although it tends to want to fall over when standing on it's own on carpet. The hose is not as long as I would have liked. My DC40 used to have a hose that reached all the way to the top of my stairs. This one does not. I also suspect it has less suction than the DC40, although I can't prove it. Con: Very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Leader Desslok

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum! Seems like poor quality at first. But has held up well. Still works great after having for 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: AButton

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The product wouldnt even pick up things as simple as a pine needle on a hard wood surface and after a week of use stopped working completely. I would give it zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Olgie

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We had the older model Dyson (Yellow) for years!!!! Loved it!!!! So decided to purchase a Dyson once again!!! This model sucks to say the least!!!! Constantly getting clogged up by the filter!!! Have to literally stick your hand up inside to get all the hair and dust out!! And it loses suction ALL the time!!!!!! Very cheaply made on top of that!!!!! We are Now out $400.00 + !!!! Guess it's time to find a new name brand we can trust!!! :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not a toy and worth every penny.  overall a great vacuum at almost half the weight as the older models
customer_reviews.text: wow... what a vacuum .... half the weight as our older yellow dyson and works just as well if not better ... love the way it looks, rolls, moves and feels. Vacuums up dog hair with no problem at all. cleans carpets and wood floors with no hesitation at all. Beside the fact that it looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Kawfeeman

customer_reviews.title: Money can buy happiness
customer_reviews.text: We already have a Dyson DC44, the handheld version, but I was tired of the limited battery life when vacuuming rugs and my husband refused to give up his heavy Eureka upright. I ordered this as a X'mas gift for hubby over the Cyber Monday sale, and just happily vaccuumed the whole house. It's super light, easy to maneuver, long cord. This vacuum is perfect for our household needs. Oh, I forgot to mention, I have fur generating chattel: a shiba inu and a long coat Japanese Akita.
customer_reviews.author: rikumom

customer_reviews.title: Design and engineering...respect
customer_reviews.text: The lightweight design, power, and design of integrated tools is very impressive. It is easy to remove hair and threads from the roller, without the need for tools.
customer_reviews.author: geek extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: Great compact vacuum for pet owners
customer_reviews.text: I was dumbfounded at the amount of pet hair and dirt this vacuum pulled out of our carpet. We'd used a smaller, cheaper Dirt Devil vacuum in our house that I guess we picked up at Target, and as soon as we got the Dyson onto our floor, we couldn't believe the difference. It's a bit more compact than I was anticipating (smaller than any I'd used before) but it outperforms any vacuum I've ever owned. The only thing I wish was different is the size of the canister. It's bagless, which is great, but it is also very compact so we find ourselves emptying the canister very frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Monsen

customer_reviews.title: finally tried a dyson
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift for dog owners, and it is almost as great as they say, she loves it, but it seems to clog more than an expensive vacuum should and needs to be cleaned out a lot. but for sucking power and maneuverability, it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: llainey

customer_reviews.title: ... have a DC28 and find that it is a great product. So that one may compare this compact ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a DC28 and find that it is a great product. So that one may compare this compact upright is a good fit for a very small space. Stores away nicely. If you are looking for a heavier vacuum select a heavier model. Best feature is being compact.
customer_reviews.author: Connie T.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum!! Very lightweight, good suction, and it collapses to a very nice size for those that have small spaces to store it. Fits perfectly in my closet and is the right height while I'm using it. The registration process was easy too with Dyson. Smooth transaction and delivered as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G

customer_reviews.title: Used very light, only one rig in house. ...
customer_reviews.text: Used very light, only one rig in house. Only lasted 16 months. For price you would think it would have lasted a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Nice mini vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works but much smaller than expected. I was replacing an Animal 2 and was unprepared for exactly how mini this vacuum would be in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: TheProfessor

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum ever
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about spending so much on a vacuum, but I went for it. Best vacuum ever. It gets everything up in just a pass or two, and I can vacuum much faster with this vacuum. Highly recommend it. You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Works great on carpet but on hardwood it is only ok
customer_reviews.text: Works great on carpet but on hardwood it is only ok. The hose assembly is wonky too because of the extra long inflexible initial part. So you either have to remove it which is a pain in the arse and makes it considerably shorter, or you have a very stiff inflexible wand.
customer_reviews.author: mlloyLGT

customer_reviews.title: Beyond My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had a very powerful, but heavy, cumbersome vacuum which I loved because it picked up everything.., my sister's son and his wife got this vacuum and raved about it. I wanted something not so heavy to pull around, but just as powerful, so I took a chance and got this one. WOW! The same or better power....light weight....and it's AMAZiNG to see all the dirt .....no bag to change....I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Millie Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Best Vacuum Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has changed my life! Instead of fighting with my 20-year-old Kirby and having to scrape up pet fur before even running the vacuum, I now look forward to vacuuming and enjoy seeing how clean my carpets look. And I don't have to do any scraping, either. It's very light and takes up little space.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia A. McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of getting cat fur off the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Evergreen

customer_reviews.title: Most Amazing Vacuum I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I literally went over my living room carpet with my old vacuum right before unboxing the Dyson DC50. I went over the carpet again, and filled the Dyson's storage tank 3 times! That either speaks for the lack of quality from my previous vacuum, or the power of this one. A month in, and I'm still amazed every time I use it. The only down side is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pchild

customer_reviews.title: Good for small messes
customer_reviews.text: Very riggetty. Not for big jobs since canister is small, have to empty a lot. Good for small messes. Does get clogged, but they have made it easy to snap apart clean out. I must say it is easy to push. I don't feel like it is built as well as my full size Dyson Animal. I've had that one for more than 10 years. I have a feeling that this one won't last that long. Plus, very expensive for such a small machine. Time will tell
customer_reviews.author: sheila j.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and with pets
customer_reviews.text: Bought our first Dyson Animal vacuum over 12 years ago and have never bought another brand or model since. This is a more compact model with the same power and suction. Very pleased and with pets, this vacuum really stands up to the job
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: it works amazing as did the other
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Dyson for about 10 years and when the new one arrived I was really worried because it seemed so much smaller. There was nothing to worry about, it works amazing as did the other, just an easier size to handle and carry from floor to floor. Would definelty buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a while then all the plastic pieces started breaking and it was cheaper to just buy a new vacuum than buy the replacement parts
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Lollar

customer_reviews.title: Suction s*
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to invest in a really good vacuum cleaner and spent nearly $400 for a Dyson. It's awful. I cannot say one good thing about it other than it's light. It keeps breaking, suction s*. My former $100 vacuum is 10 times better
customer_reviews.author: IBA

customer_reviews.title: the suction isn't as powerful as the kirby but it's pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: very light. i got this to replace my kirby. for some reason the kirby was scratching my new wood floors. this does not. the suction isn't as powerful as the kirby but it's pretty darn good!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Higher cost doesn’t always mean better. This one didn’t last as long as the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third and last Dyson. Higher cost doesn’t always mean better. This one didn’t last as long as the other two. After about 18 months it failed to stay upright which means you can’t use the hose attachment without holding it up with your other hand. Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: It is still running like a top
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dyson that I purchased as a refurbished unit from Amazon many years ago! It is still running like a top. This new one is much smaller and not as easy to adjust, but it vacuums quite well -- as all Dysons do.
customer_reviews.author: Judy@Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Don't like this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this vacuum. There are too many parts to clog. The bin wont empty all the way without having to pull dirt out with my hand or a chop stick. Clogs happen every time I vacuum. I have 3 dogs and really wanted to love this vacuum. Would love my money back. Dyson???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to move
customer_reviews.text: So easy to move. This would be great if you have a bad back or if you are pregnant. Sometimes if doesn't pick up small pieces which is a plus if you have kids with legos. Attachments need to be ordered to go with it to really get into corners and for cleaning fans and couches.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: I got it because I love Dyson and this model was lighter than my other ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it because I love Dyson and this model was lighter than my other Dyson. However, when I pull out the extension wand to vacuum the corners and window area, the entire vacuum falls over because it is too light. It does great vacuuming as an upright vacuum though. It is great around tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Esther Lee

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing vacuum. It has,incredible suction and, it's so handy for spills, furniture.-It charges really fast and it's super easy to dump the contents and, keep in going
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Hartle

customer_reviews.title: Really?
customer_reviews.text: I am sorely disappointed in this vacuum cleaner. I'm still on the fence about returning it...only used it twice... what is the return policy anyway? Why it's called an animal vacuum cleaner befuddles me. It is so small. I'm going to have to keep my older larger Dyson to do all the initial work and if I keep this one, use it to follow the first cleaning because the ONE thing it has going for it is that it does have good suction power. They mean it when they say it's compact. I'm thinking the DC41 animal is the way to go...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really small!
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum power. I had the larger one prior and it makes a difference on the volume it will hold. Seems much more unstable when using than the larger upright. I guess if you had an apartment and a kitty.... It would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartment.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and small. Perfect for my one bedroom apartment. Would not recommend for a larger house unless you have two vacuums but it's great for me. Power cord and accessory hose could be longer, canister could be larger but I like the compact size. Parts are all plastic so it's light but I wonder how many years I'll get out of it if with parts that can snap off. Still....I like it now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How I love this vacuum,  let me count the ways
customer_reviews.text: We are so loving our new vacuum. Never had we had better suction or adaptability (attachments) to pick up dog fur around the house. It works equally well on hardwood and carpet. Best money we have spent in some time.
customer_reviews.author: Puddle dive

customer_reviews.title: The WORST EVER!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After waiting for years to purchase a Dyson this is by far the worst vacuum in the world. I bought this as a Christmas present to myself; It lost suction less than 48 ours after purchase. I know Dyson's are great;is just the seller selling defective products
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Pegs

customer_reviews.title: It's an animal -- on dirt!
customer_reviews.text: The Dyson Ball Compact Animal -- is an animal on dirt! One cat, and a no shoe house does not make us immune to dirt, dust and dander. The first pass over a recently vacuumed rug gave me a rather big surprise (a ton of unseen fur and dirt.) Light, quieter than my Kenmore HEPA canister, I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of using this vacuum. Easy to empty the tank of dirt and debris.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this thing really sucks! Found dirt we never knew about. we are cleaner now because of Dyson.
customer_reviews.author: pscoatx

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super fast shipping. I love it!! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best vacuum ever. So easy to use and empty. Impressive suction. I love my dyson vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: darcy Bondhus

customer_reviews.title: THe product is great. What they didn't tell you is that seller ...
customer_reviews.text: THe product is great. What they didn't tell you is that seller or manufacturer may not stand behind the warranty because it was sold by a 3rd party retailer.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: but it's a great vacuum otherwise
customer_reviews.text: My cleaner says the animal hair still won't get the dog hair out of my ikea couch fabric, but it's a great vacuum otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Hiker

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't ask for a better vacuum! This one is very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't ask for a better vacuum! This one is very powerful! I have a German Shepherd/Rottweiler mix, along with a long haired cat. I bought vacuum after vacuum, and they would only last about 6 months to a year. This one is perfect! I feel like the floor is getting clean!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Nicole Matthews

product_meta.title: Dyson DC50 Animal Compact Upright Vacuum Cleaner, Iron/Purple - Corded
feature_bullets: The Dyson Ball Compact Animal Upright is identical to the Dyson DC50 Compact Upright. It has a new name, but no change has been made to the item.
Most advanced cleaner head technology from Dyson, engineered for increased dirt pick-up across all floors
5 year parts & labor warranty when purchased from an authorized reseller
Most advanced cleaner head technology from Dyson, engineered for increased dirt pick-up across all floors
2 Tier Radial cyclones capture more microscopic particle, no bag, no loss of suction
Latest Ball technology, turns on the spot and steers more easily into difficult spaces
Ultra-lightweight and durable, weighs just 11.6 lbs. Cord Length = 25 ft.
2 Tier Radial cyclones capture more microscopic particle, no bag, no loss of suction Ultra-lightweight and durable, weighs just 11.6 lbs. Cord Length = 25 ft.

5 year warranty, parts and labor 5 year parts & labor warranty when purchased from an authorized reseller Most advanced cleaner head technology from Dyson, engineered for increased dirt pick-up across all floors 2 Tier Radial cyclones capture more microscopic particle, no bag, no loss of suction Latest Ball technology, turns on the spot and steers more easily into difficult spaces Ultra-lightweight and durable, weighs just 11.6 lbs. Cord Length = 25 ft.
